references.paper_title: Hippo: Recurrent memory with optimal polynomial projections
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational HIPPO framework for sequence modeling, which the current work extends to temporal graphs.

references.paper_title: Efficiently modeling long sequences with structured state spaces
references.reason: This paper presents refinements to the HIPPO framework, improving efficiency and addressing long-range dependencies in sequence modeling, relevant to the temporal graph setting.

references.paper_title: Combining recurrent, convolutional, and continuous-time models with linear state space layers
references.reason: This paper explores the integration of different types of sequence models with SSMs, providing a basis for the design choices in the proposed GRAPHSSM framework.

references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This seminal paper introduces inductive representation learning on graphs, foundational to many approaches in graph neural networks, including those applied to temporal graphs.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This paper introduces graph convolutional networks (GCNs), a fundamental method used in many graph neural network architectures, including those for temporal graph analysis.
